column4: I Just tried this article on applying ownership of a file to a user and it didnt work...could someone give me a link to an easy article so apply ownership of a file so i can do so.
well, what are you trying to change, exactly?
PuTTY X11 proxy: wrong authentication protocol attemptedxterm Xt error: Can't open display: localhost:10.0
is there an X server listening on localhost:10.0?
i dont know =(   this is what i get when i login to my server through putty
okay, but is there an X server running on the machines that you are trying to connect from?
if i plug my monitor and keyboard into my server and locally run 'sudo starx' it works
why sudo? you shouldn't require that for running X, and now i think i understand why your .Xauthority file has the wrong owner... ;-)
yep :) don't run startx with sudo
after running that and reconnecting via putty, i get this...http://pastebin.com/mf12fde1
and the owner is now set correctly? what is the output of ls -l now?
hmm it gives me the same thing, but i ran what you said...sudo chown corrosione:corrosione .Xauthority
try renaming the file, and have another go
